html: Drink. Hebrew, "mix shecar." People generally mixed wine and water. They also strove who could drink most, and the Greeks had a feast for this purpose, (Calmet) which they styledChoas, for the measure which was to be swallowed down. (Aristophanes, Acharn. act. iv. 4. and 5. ultra)— Cyrus the younger boasted to the Greek ambassadors, that "he could drink and bear more wine than his brother." (Plut.[Plutarch?] in Artax.)
